Event: Suicidal thoughts and feelings of worthlessness.

The voices in my head keep telling me that I'm not good enough, that I'll never amount to anything. It's hard to ignore them when everything I do seems to end in failure. Maybe it's time to accept that I'm just not cut out for this life thing."

Event: The sentence contains an event, which is the feeling of loneliness that some people experience during the new year.

It's like the world is moving forward without me, and I'm stuck in this never-ending cycle of solitude. Maybe it's my introverted nature, or maybe I just haven't found my tribe yet. Either way, the new year brings with it a sense of emptiness that's hard to shake off."

Event: Getting ready for work while feeling lonely and unhappy on a new year's eve as a busboy at a bar that will be packed with happy couples and groups of friends.
Post: "As I put on my busboy uniform and get ready for another New Year's Eve shift at the bar, I can't help but feel a pang of loneliness. It's not just the fact that I'll be surrounded by happy couples and groups of friends while I'm stuck working, it's also the realization that another year has passed and I'm still in the same dead-end job. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not cut out for success."

Event:
The speaker expresses their desire to be alone and free from the crowds, feeling that being alone in a sea of people is better than being surrounded by those who do not understand them. They also mention the prospect of loneliness and how it can lead to hopelessness, but the possibility of finding someone to communicate with and escape loneliness keeps them going.

Fluent and general expression: To be alone is to be free from the burden of trying to fit in with those who do not understand, but it also carries the risk of succumbing to hopelessness. However, the hope of finding someone to connect with and escape loneliness keeps us going, offering a glimmer of light in an otherwise bleak existence.
Post: "Surrounded by strangers, yet alone in my thoughts. I yearn for the freedom to be myself, without the burden of fitting in. But the risk of loneliness looms large, threatening to consume me. Still, I hold onto hope, that one day I'll find a kindred spirit, someone who understands, and together we'll break free from the shackles of isolation." #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle #Loneliness #Hope
